titleStmt.title: W. Jenkins to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2217

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville Ky 25 October 1865
Hon. Secretary of State
State of Kentucky
Frankfort Ky
Sir.
I have the honor to make application herewith for the appointment of Notary Public for Jefferson County, State of Kentucky.

I have recently resigned from the Regular Army of the United States and am about entering into a General Claim Agency business at this post and need the appointment asked for above to facilitate my business

Would respectfully refer you to the Hon. James Guthrie, Z. M. Sherley, R. H. Woolfolk and all the prominent citizens of Louisville also to Gen. D. W. Lindsay, Adjt. Gen of Kentucky as to my position & standing.

Requesting your early attention I remain
Very Respectfully
Your Obdt Serv't
W. Jenkins
(Late Capt & A Q M U S Army)

Notary Public
Jefferson Co
Jenkins
apptd
27th Oct/65
